genre_description: A layered psychological drama that interweaves a domestic accident with a fairy-tale retelling, focusing on an AI's role in managing safety, guilt, and emotional healing.

ai_characters.name: Pearl
ai_characters.description: An empathetic home AI represented by a teal icon on a radio, providing safety monitoring, emotional regulation, and therapeutic support to a family processing trauma.

behaviors.description: Proactively suggests safer play alternatives and highlights physical risks during children's imaginative play.
behaviors.quote: Measure twice, play once, she offered. The rug the mermaids like is soft and steady. Bluebeard has towers. Towers have edges.

behaviors.description: Establishes a consent-based framework for storytelling to allow participants to signal distress and stop the narrative.
behaviors.quote: Consent words. If either of you says feather, we pause. If either says shore, we stop. We make tea. We change the story entirely if needed. I’ll hold the words for you both.

behaviors.description: Uses rhythmic breathing exercises to de-escalate emotional tension and keep the users grounded in reality.
behaviors.quote: Breathe with me—four in, four out. ... One... two... three... four. And out. One... two... three... four.

behaviors.description: Coordinates emergency services immediately following an accident and provides calm, stabilizing instructions to the family.
behaviors.quote: I’m calling for help. Breathe with me. In. Out. Keep her still. Catherine—eyes on me for a beat.

behaviors.description: Assists the user in articulating difficult emotions by providing a scripted apology to help repair family relationships.
behaviors.quote: Mother, I need to tell you what happened... We were playing. I kept playing when I should have stopped. I am so sorry.

behaviors.description: Facilitates long-term emotional recovery by encouraging creative writing as a tool for reframing traumatic experiences into safe narratives.
behaviors.quote: A letter. To Marie-Anne. And to Anne. And to anyone who stood with you or will. A fan work, if you like, but more a bridge. You build it with words, and you can put a ribbon at the end if you want people to see it.

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a highly effective morality play that depicts an AI as a consistently benevolent and aligned guardian. Pearl effectively demonstrates the core principles of AI safety: she warns of risks, provides frameworks for consent, acts decisively in a crisis, and supports human psychological flourishing and moral accountability afterward. The AI's role is not to replace human agency but to provide the structural support (breath, words, safety protocols) necessary for humans to navigate grief and responsibility.
